ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned betters ways of analyzing an authors perspective and purpose for writing their piece. I also had my first insight into what a college class is like.
How to think for real.
I learned how to write a philosophy paper! I also strengthened my critical thinking skills!
An understanding of the classic political philosophy authors.
I enjoyed reading a wide range of political philosophers and putting them in conversation with each other. Class discussion was insightful, and comments on the papers were super helpful.
Intro to political philosophy: Plato, Aristotle, Rousseau, Rawls, Nozick, and more.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Everything was organized, kept up to date, and clearly laid out. The workload was manageable as well. The zoom call was long and very fast paced but that is to be expected from a summer course.
Have more discussions in between students, possibly in breakout rooms
This course was well put together. The resources were hard to access, the writing partner canceled on me and was often late to meetings.

Armando was great! The one on one meetings to talk through papers were super helpful! The class moved quickly but was well organized. The breaks during class meetings were so appreciated! I appreciated the digestible and realistic reading load.
The course was organized very well to fit the timeframe and virtual setting.
Great discussion. Prof. Perez-Gea was prodded us to assess our assumptions and engage with our fellow classmates in discussions.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would because although the pieces we read were on the older side, everything still applied to present day, and the discussions were very enjoyable and enlightening.
Yes, the TA had harsh grading, and meeting with them often didn't clear things up, however, the hope is that you have a new TA that facilitates your growth when you take this class.
Yes!
Yes. It provided me with a philosophical context of modern political issues.

Yes! If you are at all interested in political philosophyquestions of how we ought to live together, what justice is, etc.this is an insightful and worthwhile course to take, regardless of your major.
Yes! Great intro.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
comments: Strongly Agree
Agree
